H0.text: Atoms are the particles that ancient Greeks propose matter consists of.

H1.text: Ions are the particles that the ancient Greeks proposed matter consists of.

H2.text: Molecules are the particles that ancient Greeks proposed matter consists of.

H3.text: Ether is the particle ancient Greeks proposed that matter consists of.

A4.text: In the 5th century BC, Leucippus and his pupil Democritus proposed that all matter was composed of small indivisible particles which they called 'atoms'.

A5.text: Atomism (from Ancient Greek ἄτομον (atomon) 'uncuttable, indivisible') is a natural philosophy proposing that the physical universe is composed of fundamental indivisible components known as atoms.
